Membership of the AGH University of Krakow in the Euraxess Network

Membership of the AGH University of Krakow in the Euraxess Network

We are pleased to announce that AGH University has joined the European EURAXESS network, supporting foreign scientists and the institutions employing them in the field of mobility and career development. The European network EURAXESS – Researchers in Motion has been operating in 43 countries since 2004. 9 EURAXESS Worldwide offices located outside of Europe engage scientists around the world to get to know European research and innovation market and facilitate collaboration with Europe. Network’s activities in Poland are coordinated by the Polish National Agency for Academic Exchange. Network members exchange knowledge and experiences to expand professionalization of their activities. Membership in EURAXESS allows participation in European initiatives, projects, events and provides international networking opportunities.

Access to research funding opportunities:

Database of Polish job and funding opportunities for scientists
 The latest offers are published on the Polish website in the form of a monthly newsletter.

A database of job and grant opportunities in Europe
 and other regions of the world.

Access to personalised support:

Personalised assistance
 with formalities and administrative aspects of entry, work and stay in Poland

Customised information
 on formalities related to arriving, working and living in a EURAXESS member country and contacts to more than 
670 Welcome Centres
. National portals also provide information on national grants and programmes for research funding, as well as events related to career development and international mobility

Access to scientific career development:

Tools, training, mentoring and guidance
 to support career planning and cross-sectoral development 

Opportunities to strengthen international scientific cooperation
. EURAXESS Hubs integrate European researchers working all around the world

Opportunities for research networking
 and building partnerships

More about the initiative can be found at
